findings.title: QSP-1 Approved Funds Can Be Exploited by Attackers
findings.description: The funds approved to the `Api3Pool` can be withdrawn by an attacker using `TimelockUtils.depositWithVesting` and `TimelockUtils.updateTimelockStatus` due to allowing `msg.sender` to input any value for `source` address while not restricting the function access to only the timelock manager address.

findings.title: Unchecked return value of ERC20 transfer and transferFrom calls
findings.description: The return values of ERC20 transfer and transferFrom calls are not checked to be true in several functions.

findings.title: Redundant requirement in StateUtils.setStakeTarget
findings.description: The requirement _stakeTarget >= 0 is redundant and can be removed as the variable is a uint256.

findings.title: Potentially dangerous strict equalities
findings.description: Slither reported several potentially dangerous strict equalities of the form totalSharesCheckpoint2.fromBlock == block.number.
